com.enterprise_architecture.essential.widgets
Class AutoTextListener

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.smi.protege.event.FrameAdapter
      com.enterprise_architecture.essential.widgets.AutoTextListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.stanford.smi.protege.event.FrameListener, java.util.EventListener
public class AutoTextListener
extends edu.stanford.smi.protege.event.FrameAdapter

Listener class to listen for changes to the Slots and SlotWidgets that are being used to create auto text in an AutoTextWidget. The listener is registered to each Instance of the Slot that is defined as part of the AutoText configuration and then updates the parent AutoTextWidget when changes occur.

Since:
version 1: 07.12.2006
Version:
1.1.1 - 12.09.2007. Fixed to work with Protege 3.3+., 1.1.2 - 15.01.2008. Resolved missing update events in client-server mode., 1.2 - 08.12.2008. Refactored package name.
Author:
Jonathan W. Carter
See Also:
AutoTextWidget

browserTextChanged

public void browserTextChanged(edu.stanford.smi.protege.event.FrameEvent theEvent)
Handle updates to the browser text of Slot instances by informing the parent AutoText to re-set its values to pick up the change. However only do this if the browserText has really changed.

Specified by:
browserTextChanged in interface edu.stanford.smi.protege.event.FrameListener
Overrides:
browserTextChanged in class edu.stanford.smi.protege.event.FrameAdapter
Parameters:
theEvent - events including the creation of new instances in InstanceFieldWidgets.
Since:
version 1.1.2 - Updated to catch all relevent updates but stop looping.

addListening

public void addListening(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Instance theFrame)
Record the fact that this Listener is listening to the specified Frame Instance.

Parameters:
theFrame - the instance of the Frame that is being listened to. This is a Protege Instance object and is intended to listen to the instance of a SlotWidget used in an AutoTextWidget auto-text template.
See Also:
AutoTextWidget

isListeningAlready

public boolean isListeningAlready(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Instance theFrame)
Is this listener already listening to the specified Instance?

Parameters:
theFrame - an Instance (the instance of a SlotWidget that is being used in an AutoTextWidget auto-text template) that is either already being listened to or not.
Returns:
true if this listener is already listening to the specified Instance. false otherwise.

stopListening

public void stopListening()
Stop listenting to all the Frames that are registered with this listener.

handleSlotValueChange

private void handleSlotValueChange(edu.stanford.smi.protege.event.FrameEvent theEvent)
Do the main work for handling the event. This is called by ownSlotValueChanged() Handle changes to the ownSlotValue of Slot instances by informing the parent AutoText to re-set its values to pick up the change

Parameters:
theEvent - an containing details of the slot that has changed in this Frame.

handleBrowserTextChange

private void handleBrowserTextChange(edu.stanford.smi.protege.event.FrameEvent theEvent)
Handle events notifying of browserTextChange(). The event only triggers a change to the AutoText when the Slot in theEvent is null or if it's a Slot that isn't used in the AutoText template. This avoids duplication with ownSlotValueChange() events.

Parameters:
theEvent - the event that was raised when the browser text was changed. only processed if the slot in the event is null or it's not an event from a slot that is being monitored already.

isRepeatedEvent

private boolean isRepeatedEvent(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Slot theUpdatedSlot)
Determine whether the event notifying of a change to the specified slot has already been handled. The name and text value of the slot are tested

Parameters:
theUpdatedSlot - the slot that has fired a value changed event.
Returns:
true if the criteria match the last recorded Slot update, false otherwise (a new update).

storeLastSlotUpdate

private void storeLastSlotUpdate(edu.stanford.smi.protege.model.Slot theLastChangedSlot)
Save the relevent details of a Slot that has changed its value. These details are used to determine whether a new slot changed event is in fact a repeat, e.g. when a Frame dialog is open.

Parameters:
theLastChangedSlot - the Slot that was updated last.
